cnbc.title: Trump praises NYC Mayor-elect Mamdani after White House meeting, shrugs off being called 'fascist'
cnbc.summary: The meeting with Trump was requested by Mamdani, whose victory over ex-New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo in NYC's mayoral race put him at the center of U.S. politics.

cnbc.title: Fed won't get key inflation data before next rate decision as BLS cancels October CPI release
cnbc.summary: The BLS said it was canceling the release of the October CPI, leaving the Fed without a key piece of inflation data before it next decides on interest rates.

cnbc.title: Amazon cut more than 1,800 engineers in record layoffs, despite saying it needs to innovate faster
cnbc.summary: Nearly 40% of the roughly 4,700 positions Amazon eliminated across Washington, New York, New Jersey and California were engineering jobs.

cnbc.title: Tech stocks wrap big losing week as AI names get rocked after Nvidia earnings
cnbc.summary: Investors had looked to Nvidia's earnings report to settle fears that the AI bubble is on increasingly shaky ground.

cnbc.title: Why Trump's tariff rollback won't lower grocery prices right away
cnbc.summary: President Donald Trump is rolling back tariffs on some imported food items, but that won't lower prices at the grocery store right away.

cnbc.title: Paramount, Comcast, Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
cnbc.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery recently expanded its strategic review of its business, saying it's open for a sale. First-round bids came in this week.

cnbc.title: Robinhood shares drop 12% this week amid losses in bitcoin, AI stocks
cnbc.summary: The platform's core business relies on retail investors pouring into speculative corners of the market, particularly crypto and AI-linked stocks.

cnbc.title: Google must double AI serving capacity every 6 months to meet demand, AI infrastructure boss tells employees
cnbc.summary: At a recent all-hands meeting, Google's head of AI infrastructure said the company has to race to build out compute capacity.

cnbc.title: Air traffic controllers, technicians with perfect attendance in shutdown to get $10,000 bonuses, FAA says
cnbc.summary: Close to 800 air traffic controllers and technicians with perfect attendance will get $10,000 bonuses, the FAA said.
